title: Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint in the breakpoints pane of the debug perspective, if the cancel button is clicked in the progress dialog, the progress dialog closes immediately. However, the exception list still appears, and the cancellation request is ignored.
EB: The progress dialog should either honor the cancellation request and not display the exception list, or disable the cancel button when calling the ProgressMonitorDialog.run method by passing 'false' for the 'cancelable' parameter.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective. 
2) Click the J! button to add an exception. 
3) In the progress dialog, click cancel.
